# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is the Julia code for your requirement:
```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime=now(), bump::Int=3)
    if typeof(dt) <: Date 
        throw(ArgumentError("Provided timestamp must be of DateTime type"))
    else
       return dt + Hour(bump)
    end
end
```
This function takes two arguments, `dt` and `bump`. If no argument is provided, it will use the current system time as input. If a different `dt` value is supplied, it checks whether this `dt` is of type `Date`, if so, it throws an error. Otherwise, it adds the number of hours specified by `bump` to `dt`. 

The function will return a new DateTime object that represents the updated time.
